27  using namespace std;
28 
29  RTKernel::RTKernel(Scheduler *s, const std::string& name, CPU* c)
30  : Entity(name),
31  _sched(s),
32  _resMng(0),
33  _cpu(),
34  internalCpu(true),
35  beginDispatchEvt(this),
36  endDispatchEvt(this),
37  _isContextSwitching(false),
38  _contextSwitchDelay(0)
39  {
40  __reginstr_init();
41  __regsched_init();
42  __regtask_init();
43 
44  _currExe = NULL;
45 
46  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
47 
48  /* In this constructor the user can decide to provide
49  a particular CPU or not. If a CPU is provided
50  (i.e. c!=NULL), that particular CPU will be
51  used. Otherwise, a new CPU without power saving
52  functions is created (using the statement new), and
53  a boolean variable (i.e. internalCpu) is set. This
54  variable specifies if the CPU must be deleted in
55  the kernel destructor.
56  */
57  if (c != NULL){
58  _cpu = c;
59  internalCpu = false;
60  }
61  else{
62  // Creates a CPU without power saving:
63  _cpu = new CPU;
64  }
65 
66 
67  s->setKernel(this);
68  }
69 
70  RTKernel::~RTKernel()
71  {
72  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
73  DBGPRINT("Destructor of RTKernel");
74  if (internalCpu == true){
75  DBGPRINT("Deleting internal CPU in the kernel");
76  delete _cpu;
77  }
78 
79  }
80 
81  void RTKernel::addTask(AbsRTTask &t, const string &params)
82  {
83  t.setKernel(this);
84  _handled.push_back(&t);
85  _sched->addTask(&t, params);
86  }

89  CPU* RTKernel::getProcessor(const AbsRTTask* t) const
90  {
91  return _cpu;
92  }

94  CPU* RTKernel::getOldProcessor(const AbsRTTask* t) const
95  {
96  return _cpu;
97  }

99  void RTKernel::activate(AbsRTTask *task)
100  {
101  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
102 
103  _sched->insert(task);
104  }

107  AbsRTTask* RTKernel::getCurrExe() const
108  {
109  return _currExe;
110  }

112 
113  void RTKernel::suspend(AbsRTTask *task)
114  {
115  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
116 
117  _sched->extract(task);
118 
119  if (_currExe == task) {
120  task->deschedule();
121  _currExe = NULL;
122  }
123 
124 
125  }
126 
127  void RTKernel::discardTasks(bool f)
128  {
129  _sched->discardTasks(f);
130  _handled.clear();
131  }
132 
133  void RTKernel::onArrival(AbsRTTask *task)
134  {
135  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
136  DBGPRINT_2("Inserting ",
137  taskname(task));
138 
139  _sched->insert(task);
140 
141  if(!_isContextSwitching){
142  dispatch();
143  } else {
144  beginDispatchEvt.drop();
145  beginDispatchEvt.post(endDispatchEvt.getTime());
146  }
147 
148 
149 
150  }
151 
152  void RTKernel::onEnd(AbsRTTask *task)
153  {
154  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
155 
156  if (getProcessor(task) == NULL) {
157  throw RTKernelExc("Received a onEnd of a non executing task");
158  }
159  _sched->extract(task);
160  _currExe = NULL;
161 
162  dispatch();
163 
164 
165  }
166 
167  void RTKernel::dispatch()
168  {
169  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
170 
171  // we have only to post an Dispatch event (low priority)
172 
173  beginDispatchEvt.drop();
174  beginDispatchEvt.post(SIMUL.getTime());
175 
176 
177  }
178 
179  void RTKernel::onBeginDispatch(Event* e)
180  {
181  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
182 
183  AbsRTTask *newExe = _sched->getFirst();
184 
185  if (newExe != NULL)
186  DBGPRINT_2("From sched: ",
187  taskname(newExe));
188 
189  if(_currExe != newExe){
190  if (_currExe != NULL){
191  _currExe->deschedule();
192  }
193  if( newExe != NULL) {
194  _isContextSwitching = true;
195  _currExe = newExe;
196  endDispatchEvt.post(SIMUL.getTime() + _contextSwitchDelay);
197  }
198  }
199  else {
200  _sched->notify(newExe);
201  if (newExe != NULL)
202  DBGPRINT_2("Now Running: ",
203  taskname(newExe));
204  }
205 
206 
207  }
208 
209 
210  void RTKernel::onEndDispatch(Event* e)
211  {
212  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
213 
214 // AbsRTTask *newExe = _sched->getFirst();
215 
216  // we are sure that _currExe is not NULL
217 
218  _currExe->schedule();
219 
220  DBGPRINT_2("Now Running: ",
221  taskname(_currExe));
222 
223  _isContextSwitching = false;
224  _sched->notify(_currExe);
225 
226 
227  }
228 
229 
230  void RTKernel::refresh()
231  {
232  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
233 
234  dispatch();
235 
236 
237  }
238 
239  void RTKernel::setResManager(ResManager* rm)
240  {
241  _resMng = rm;
242  _resMng->setKernel(this, _sched);
243  }
244 
245  bool RTKernel::requestResource(AbsRTTask *t, const string &r, int n)
246  throw(RTKernelExc)
247  {
248  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
249 
250  if (_resMng == 0) throw RTKernelExc("Resource Manager not set!");
251  bool ret = _resMng->request(t,r,n);
252  if (!ret)
253  dispatch();
254 
255 
256  return ret;
257  }
258 
259  void RTKernel::releaseResource(AbsRTTask *t, const string &r, int n)
260  throw(RTKernelExc)
261  {
262  if (_resMng == 0) throw RTKernelExc("Resource Manager not set!");
263 
264  _resMng->release(t,r,n);
265 
266  dispatch();
267  }
268 
269  void RTKernel::setThreshold(const int th)
270  {
271  DBGENTER(_KERNEL_DBG_LEV);
272 
273  _sched->setThreshold(_currExe, th);
274 
275 
276  }

316  std::vector<std::string> RTKernel::getRunningTasks()
317  {
318  std::vector<std::string> tmp_ts;
319  std::string tmp_name = taskname(_currExe);
320 
321  if (tmp_name != "(nil)")
322  tmp_ts.push_back(tmp_name);
323 
324  return tmp_ts;
325  }
326 }
